definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The members of our office get along like a family.
sentences.chinese: 我們辦公室的同事親如一家。

sentences.english: We lived together for more than two years, so came.
sentences.chinese: 我們在一起生活了兩年多，所以親如一家人。

sentences.english: Lennon encourages the world to live as brothers and sisters;
sentences.chinese: 列儂希望世界人民能真正的團結起來，親如一家。
就像兄弟姐妹親如一家。

sentences.english: All things are connected like the blood which unites one family.
sentences.chinese: 世間萬物皆血脈相連，親如一家。

sentences.english: Because dreams faith heroes gathered together , they kinship people .
sentences.chinese: 主人公們因爲夢想信仰聚在了一起，他們親如一家人。

sentences.english: Over the years, we as a close, mutual trust, and common progress.
sentences.chinese: 多年以來，我們親如一家，彼此信任，共同前進。

sentences.english: We the fam and loyalty never change up.
sentences.chinese: 我們親如一家永不改變。
